results.abstract: Mike Freeman Sports of The Times column argues that men's tennis is faceless and uninspiring, and blames elitist attitude that ignores urban audience for lack of public interest; photo (M)

headline.main: Sports of The Times; Tennis Neglects Urban Pipeline at Its Peril

results.snippet: MARVIN and BARBARA SCHAFFER, a couple from Long Island, have been following professional tennis for decades. They are hard-core, dedicated fans. Sitting halfway up the steep Arthur Ashe Stadium, they watched the day's matches at the United States...
results.lead_paragraph: MARVIN and BARBARA SCHAFFER, a couple from Long Island, have been following professional tennis for decades. They are hard-core, dedicated fans. Sitting halfway up the steep Arthur Ashe Stadium, they watched the day's matches at the United States Open late last week and came to the conclusion many others have come to: sitting through men's tennis can be about as enjoyable as a case of the mumps. ''There's no real interesting men to follow right now,'' Barbara said. ''They're boring. They're not good sports sometimes. They're not that talented, either.''

results.abstract: Russian space agency removes 'N Sync pop star Lance Bass from passenger list of October flight to International Space Station after corporate sponsors fail to make $20-million payment; photo (M)

headline.main: Russia Scraps Space Plans Of Pop Star

results.snippet: The Russian Aviation and Space Agency scrubbed the teenage idol and pop singer Lance Bass today from its passenger list for an October flight to the International Space Station, saying that in the end Mr. Bass lacked the right stuff for space travel....
results.lead_paragraph: The Russian Aviation and Space Agency scrubbed the teenage idol and pop singer Lance Bass today from its passenger list for an October flight to the International Space Station, saying that in the end Mr. Bass lacked the right stuff for space travel. The right stuff being, in this case, $20 million, payable in advance, thank you.
